greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array 2^(m-1)*(3^n+1), read by antidiagonals.
comment: Rectangular array giving the number of 1's in any row of Pascal's Triangle (mod 3) whose row number has exactly m 1's and n 2's in its ternary expansion (listed by antidiagonals).
a(m,n) is independent of the number of zeros in the ternary expansion of the row number.
a(m,n) gives a non-recursive formula for A206424.
link: Marcus Jaiclin, et al. Pascal's Triangle, Mod 2,3,5
example: Initial 5 X 5 block of entries (upper corner is (m,n)=(0,0), m increases down, n increases across):
Pascal's Triangle (mod 3), row numbers in ternary:
results.author: _Marcus Jaiclin_, Feb 07 2012
